scenarioDescription:
The 2MASS J01225093-2439505 Exoplanetary System


Overview

2MASS J01225093-2439505 is a star with 0.4 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.37 times its radius. It is located 110.33 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 0.12 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

2MASS J01225093-2439505 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the 2MASS J01225093-2439505 system


2MASS J01225093-2439505 b

2MASS J01225093-2439505 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2013-09, using the imaging method. Its semi-major axis is 52.00 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of 2MASS J01225093-2439505 b is 7791.000 times the mass of Earth. The radius of 2MASS J01225093-2439505 b is 11.209 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, 2MASS J01225093-2439505 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system 2MASS J01225093-2439505, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory.
name: 2MASS J01225093-2439505 - System With 1 Exoplanet
